New Records: Golden State Warriors extended their 14th straight regular season win over the Houston Rockets and their 8th consecutive win in Houston.
Tari Eason scored a career-high 27 points.
Key Match Events: The Rockets tied the game with an 18-2 run in the fourth quarter.
Golden State scored the first six points of overtime to extend their lead to 125-119.
Aaron Holiday stole the ball from Draymond Green and fouled him out, leading to Tari Eason's two free throws to send the game to overtime.
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State improved to 5-1 this season without Steph Curry, who is out with a sprained left ankle.
The Rockets struggled in overtime, making just 1 of 12 shots.
Others: Golden State continued to win without Steph Curry, improving to 5-1 this season.
